div.ab1: pas nirang farāhim-*zur gereftan pas zud va raṯvi dar yazišngāh šodan va ātaš dar *ādešt bar aforuḫtan va ān kasi ke zud bāšad har do fanān bastan va raṯvi dar pas sang-e urvis šodan va āb rā pādyāvi kardan va pādyāvi ān ast ke dar barsom čidan gufte budim ke se bār az ān mašrabe-ye bozorg dar mašrabe-ye ḫord rizand va az mašrabe-ye ḫord dar mašrabe-ye bozorg rizand va āb rā nik eḥtyaṭ konand ke pāk bāšad va pas ruy-e sang-e urvis rā *sukure se tā va ǧāmdān va him va pyāle va māhruy va hāvan va daste ān āb pāk šostan va har yek se bār pas zur bar gereftan ān ast ke *sukure-ye farāhimdān va *sukure-ye zurdān har do be-dast-e čab bar-dārand va āb-e pāk be-šostan va har yek se bār pādyāb karde be-dast-e rāst bar-dārand va az ruy-e sang-e urvis bālā dārand

Then, the instructions for the taking of the zur for the farāhim (= parāhum). Then, the zud and the raṯvi have to go to the yazišngāh and kindle the fire in the fire-stand. The one who is going to be the zud has to tie the two fanān and the raṯvi has to go to the other side of the urvisgāh and to make the water pure. This making pure of the water is what we have already described in the section about the cutting of the barsom (NerBarsomCidan1.5). He should pour three times water from the big vessel to the small vessel and from the small vessel to the big one. He should treat the water carefully so that it becomes pure. Afterwards he should wash with this water the three sukure, the ǧāmdān, the hum, the cup, the māhruy, the hāvan and the pestle on the urvisgāh, each one three times. Then, (it follws) the taking of the zur (zurgereftan). It consists of the follwing: He has to take with the left hand both, the sukure farāhimdān and the sukure zurdān, and wash them with pure water. Once each one has been cleaned three times, he should take them with the right hand and raise them from the stone of the urvis.
āb andar sukure-ye do tā porr kardan
He should fill the two cups with water.
us.mībarāma se bār sukure andar bālā va šeib āvardan
At †us.bībarāma he should move up and down three times the cups.
pas raθβasca bərəzatō gāθā̊sca srāuuaiiōit̰ sukure andar ruy-e sang-e urvis nahādan
And then at raθβasca bərəzatō gāθā̊sca srāuuaiiōit̰ he should put them on the surface of the stone urvis
va yek sukure-ye zarr az dast-e čab-e māhruy benahišn
And he should put a golden sukure on the left side of the māhruy.
